# Word Quirks

Quarto supports rendering to Microsoft Word (.docx) and allows you to customise the output using a reference Word document. This is useful for applying corporate styles, headers, footers, and other Word-specific formatting.
For more details, see:

[Quarto Word Output Formats](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/ms-word.html)
[Quarto Word Templates](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/ms-word-templates.html)

## Using a Reference Word Document

To apply custom Word styles, specify a reference .docx file in your documentâ€™s YAML front matter. This file can include:

* Headers and footers
* Custom paragraph and text styles
* Page layout settings

Example YAML:

```
format:
  docx:
    reference-doc: "Reference Doc/vacancy_report_template.docx"
```

Use the following YAML to use a reference .docx file. This file can contain all the usual content a .docx file might have. Like headers, footers, custom word styles

## Applying Custom Word Styles in Quarto

You can apply styles defined in your reference document using custom attributes. For example:

```
::: {custom-style="Key Points"}
This text will be in the "Key Points" style.
:::
```

```         
format: docx: reference-doc: Reference Doc/vacancy_report_template.docx
```

Use bold over any parameterised value to indicate to end users that this part of text has been dynamic.

## How to create breaks

To insert a page break in Word output, use:

```
\pagebreak
```

For linebreaks:
```
\
```
